Our daughter Carsyn was born at Ochsner Jefferson. She was given a less than 5% chance of survival by the MFM doctor due to having poor lung development. Needless to say, the odds were stacked against her from the very beginning. The doctors told us that once the "cord was cut" that Carsyn would either fight to live or die. How does a parent prepare for something like this? You really don't. You just have to believe in God and pray for the best possible outcome. Luckily she survived the birth process and was rushed to the NICU. The wonderful doctors and nurses stayed with her until she was stable enough to breath with the assistance of a vent. For three months my wife and I drove to NOLA from Baton Rouge daily to let our daughter know that we were there for her. For the days that we could not make it (due to work obligations or our other children), we thanked God for the NicView Cameras provided by the Brees Dream foundation. It allowed not only my wife and I to watch over her, but our immediate family. Drew Brees is an incredible person on and off the field. His foundation and the wonderful things that his family does for the city and others around the country do not go unnoticed. Thank you Drew for your kindness. It is people like you who make this world a wonderful place. If anyone would like to see our daughters story and progress it can be found here on Facebook @ Carsyn 'N CHARGE.
I love this!!!!! What a wonderful thing for the mom's and dad's who can't be there. Thank you so much to Drew Brees and the Brees Family Foundation. That is a tremendous blessing!!

My best friends granddaughter was born a premi weighing only 1.9 lbs. Thanks to Drew Brees' contributions we were able to watch her every day until she came home. What a wonderful gift.  We live on the MS coast so to watch her progress every day with her grandmother Melissa Barker was the most amazing thing ever. A true Hero!!!!
Giving of oneself to help others - a sign of a true champion!  Thank you, Drew Brees. (This should be getting headlines instead of Brady's suspension!!)

And it is the best thing my grandson was there after his mother (SKYLA MASON) had her son at 32 weeks at ochsner main campaus and he was taking there an we was able to watch every moment . Also for the ones that dont know it is funded by the DREW BREEZ of the NEW ORLEANS SAINTS  Skyla could not hold him so her only way to see him was the cam , as all of us mothers know its hard to leave your child an she was upset til she got word she could watch him on cam ,........................................ A BIG THANKS TO DREW AND THE NEW ORLEANS SAINT...............!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! WE love our DREW
Drew Brees has such a big heart and is so very compationate! His wife is very supportive and loving as well!

Drew Brees is a 1 of a kind. They don't make men like him anymore. Brittany sure got lucky!  The best QB in the League and the most wholesome husband she could ask for! Thanks for all you do for NOLA!
I was a NICU baby 20 years ago, and I know my parents would have loved to have this technology with me!! Truly incredible what Drew Brees has done for these families and our city of New Orleans ❤️

It's wonderful to hear about people like the Brees Family who are in a position to help others, and do!
I've got nothing but love, and respect for people like that!

That is wonderful!  What a great person Drew Brees is! !!!

My son was born in September and stayed 8 1/2 months in the NICU at Ochsner Baptist and we thank God for the cameras that Drew Brees donated it helped out because we lived 2 hours away. Thank you Drew Brees you are truly a blessing

Wow NICU has certainly come a long way in the 24 years when my twins were born 3 months prematurely. God bless you Drew Brees for your generosity. What an incredible feeling for those families to know that they can check on their precious babies anytime;  especially the mothers who still wake up for those 2 am feedings even though they're not with their babies. No one that knows me can understand how a girl from Texas can be such a big Saints fan  2 words Drew Brees! !!! WHO DAT!!!!!
The Brees Family, are true Saints.....in more ways than one!!
So amazing!! My husband and I would have loved this when our 24 weeker was in the NICU. Love Drew Brees and the New Orleans Saints!!! Who Dat!!

My son was a patient at Ochsner's NICU in 2005 this would have been a God send back then. To have the ability to see my son anytime I was away from him would have been such a relief at one of the most stressful times of my life. I'm truly thankful for Drew Brees and his wife's foundation to do such an amazing thing for the parents of the babies in the NICU. God Bless them!!! And the amazing Doctors and Nurses at Ochsner's NICU.❤️👶🏼

Here is a screenshot of my son while we has in the NICU at Ochsner main campus almost 2 years ago in September. Thank you Drew Brees for your generous contributions...the Ogden family is forever grateful!!!
Thank you Drew Brees Foundation. You gave our family lots of peace of mind and much happiness being able to watch our family's little Olivia for the month she was in the NICU at Ochsners.

My daughter was born at Ochsner, premature and in the NICU many years ago. Something like this then would have been a Godsend. Drew Brees is such a stand up guy. Good as they come. Love what he, his family and his foundation have done for our state.

'Giving back' is what it is all about and obviously Drew Brees understands this.  He has been blessed and he wishes to help others.  What a wonderful thing to do for those parents who have little ones in the intensive care unit to be able to see them.  Thanks Drew for making this possible.  Blessings to all.

My grandbaby was in nicu in another hospital in another state-while I have to assume the nic view web cam there was not funded by Drew Brees, I cannot say enough about what a blessing it was to be able to see my son's baby every day. So, I know what an amazing thing the Brees Dream Foundation has done to provide this service to families of babies hospitalized here. 
You never know what life is going to bring you.  I am sure no one imagined what wonderful things would happen when New Orleans and Drew Brees chose each other.
Our Grandson was there ...how thankful we were to watch him and see his progress.. Thank you Drew Brees.

This is a wonderful addition to a NICU. I was lucky enough to be able to visit my baby in the NICU 3-4 times a day because we lived so close.  Even with that advantage I would have loved being able to see her during the times I couldn't be there.  What a wonderful way for Drew Brees to give back to the community. There is nothing better than the peace of mind you get when you can see your baby rather than relying on nurses updates over the phone in the middle of the night.
Drew Brees has a wonderful heart and the Saints are with him all the way.  WHAT A WONDERFUL GIFT FOR THOSE FAMILIES.   GO DREW

My daughter spent the first 3 months of her life in the NICU at another hospital in another city, as a father of a NICU baby, a N.O. Saints fan, and a Drew Brees fan I have to say thank you for being and continuing to be a class act who gives to the commnunity. We need more people who are able to, to step up and help those less fortunate than they are

Damm!  The time is getting short....Geaux Saints!
Any news if the saints are going to be doing a eat with the saints this year like they did last year?

Woah, Patrick Sullivan, this says "On Sunday, August 9, "Picnic with The Saints" will take place from 6:00pm-7:30 pm. This picnic celebration will include hamburgers, hotdogs, chips, watermelon and beverages. Meet and Greets along with Autograph and Photograph Opportunities will also be available. Admission to the Open Practice (4:00pm-5:50pm) prior to the Picnic with The Saints is Free. Picnic tickets are available here.

Just hope the D and others do not play with their hands on hip like last year not seeming to give a flip as most sports commentators and analyst professed. Tey were exactly right. All this train camp extravaganza. A team coming off a year so embarrassing.  Acting like they are entitled to a paycheck laughing there way to the bank and not showing up on Sunday. Cannot win games but can wrestle crocodiles. Your 20 mill a year well soent. Playing the glamor role. No proof in pudding. Thier own sign "Do your job" anything but. Did anyone watch the games last year? We will do some live streaming from our luxurious triangle camp as we sit in our Jacuzzis collecting our doe from the work for a living folks of N.O. we got it made while those 9 to 5 and more folks who think we are actually going to put forth effort kiss our butts. Time to clean house and get rid of all these fools. We deserve a winner not jokes on the field. Do your job or let us find replacements that will. Win games. Countless time heard commentators say " Saints just stand around with hands on hips like they could care or less." They are not haters. They said what they saw. The reallity of it. Flat out embarrassment.  Send Payton, Brees and company on their way time. Play till 45. I would test him too. How many interceptions can one possibly throw from his own 20 where D just smiled and waived allowing to convert to score on same pay or next. . Jimmy Graham pulling up short on timing patterns and standing watch the ball hit the ground. Good riddance. Reallity of it all. Their time is done  and they are milking it. They are taking  our faith and support cashing in  before we catch on. Reallity of it.  Planning for retirement and building that  nest egg. All just my opinion of course. Take a long hard look though.

data.name: Will the New Orleans Saints run more in 2015? John DeShazier's weekly mailbag

data.message:
Mark Ingram needs to run that ball like he did at Bama!!! A little wildcat action... #RTR

BUT SERIOUSLY... I don't want to be hearing that the New Orleans Saints will be removing the Fluer de Luis. I mean it. I don't want to be a fan of any other team, so don't force me.

Run first, run second, and give Brees 5 yards for 3rd down.  Our guy makes great decisions, we just can't be forcing Brees to convert 3rd and 10s all game long.  Plus, running kills the clock for our mediocre defense.
They will probably switch to a run first type of offense and throw if the running game is dry that game,which it would be pretty hard to stop ingram and spiller ..

They are stacked to have an awesome 1-2-3 punches with Brees, Ingram and Spiller... Brees can air it out to anyone, and he is the most accurate passer ever. Then Ingram and Spiller will both give him a break with that ground game. And having Unger at center just made that O-line a whole lot better.
Hope another zsuperbowl championship is in the card. Go Saints.

BRING THE BALANCE CLOSER!!!!  Let's not be predictable, everyone know we can and will pass. For years we have had Heisman trophy backs and never use them to the best of the team or their abilities. We end up trading a healthy back to another team. With a run game we can keep the defense a little more honest and let them know we can run the ball. 

USE THE BACKS....PERIOD!!!!

Alibi: NOT JUST PASS PROTECTION. 

DING!!!

data.message: The toughest game will always be the next game.  ONE AT A TIME.
Doesn't matter The saints will rise and win you have to believe and have faith. Go saints!!!

Being unbiased, I have them losing to the Colts & Cowboys for sure. That being said, I legitimately see them as a 11-12 win team, & winning the division. None of the other teams in the division got better, the Saints made whole-sale moves to improve. They have a potentially top tier running attack, Cooks will surprise a lot of people, Brees will be dynamic as always, & the defense will be better. The only things I think that could derail them are the offensive line, & interceptions by Brees. No one can convince me any of the three other teams in their division can win more than 8 games.

While, as some have pointed out, a large portion of this donation from Winn Dixie will not go directly to the cause, you are not actually making a donation personally. You are buying products and Winn Dixie is making the donation. When you choose to donate directly to a charity, then by all means, choose another. Don't try to dissuade people participating just because you disagree with the store's choice of charity. The bottom line is, at least they are making an effort and our wounded heroes will benefit to some extent.

From a die-hard Saints fan who is a Gold Star Mother & also has a son who is a Wounded Warrior - I beg you PLEASE don't donate to WWP.  There are much more derserving charities who actually DO things for the heroes, other than "raise awareness" and advertise.  Semper Fi Fund, Americas Fund, Fisher House Foundation, Gary Sinise Foundation, Luke's Wings, Yellow Ribbon Fund, just to name a few.  ASK ANY WOUNDED WARRIOR or thier families and you will understand

Saw some consuren about the choice of charity. This should give you some idea about where the money goes. I will ve shoping at Winn-Dixie and encouraging others to do so as well.  http://www.charitynavigator.org/index.cfm?bay=search.summary&orgid=12842#.VZVk23oo7qA

There are many charities whose funds  actually go to Veterans causes.  WWP spends their money suing other veteran charities over frivolous things and outrages salaries. Make a personal donation to other charities such as a small local charity that assist veterans your YOUR area specifically or Homes for Our Troops who build ADA homes from the ground up for our most needy and wounded warriors.
WWP is a sham. most of the money goes to the CEO and legal fights against other veteran groups.
You need to really investigate where all the proceeds to this fund really goes!
My Store and My Team... a most worthy cause and one I will be helping along... Go Winn-Dixie !

It really doesn't matter what your favorite charity is, Winn-Dixie has CHOSEN to donate all their profits for 4 July to Winn-Dixie. I agree with some of your comments but can we as a country never ever find some good in what corporations willing donate to??!! A VETERAN of 30 years.
